sentence.Network_en: The forehand stroke should be fluid and well balanced.
sentence.Network_cn: 正手击球应该保证动作流畅和平稳。

sentence.Network_en: This book is a well balanced biography.
sentence.Network_cn: 此书是一部相当客观的传记。

sentence.Network_en: The team was not well balanced.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个队的队员配备得不是很均衡。

entry.tran: 通情达理的;头脑清醒的;情绪稳定的
entry.def: If you describe someone as well-balanced, you mean that they are sensible and do not have many emotional problems.

example.tran: 喜欢玩乐、通情达理的人

entry.def: If you describe something that is made up of several parts as well-balanced, you mean that the way that the different parts are put together is good, because there is not too much or too little of any one part.

means.word_mean: 1. in an optimal state of balance or equilibrium;
